greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of connected multigraphs with n >= 0 edges and 1 <= k <= n+1 vertices, with no loops allowed.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274 (terms 0..119 from R. J. Mathar)
R. J. Mathar, Statistics on Small Graphs, arXiv:1709.09000 [math.CO], 2017; see Section 4.
Brendan McKay and Adolfo Piperno, nauty and Traces. [nauty and Traces are programs for computing automorphism groups of graphs and digraphs.]
B. D. McKay and A. Piperno, Practical Graph Isomorphism, II, J. Symbolic Computation 60 (2013), 94-112.
Gus Wiseman, Illustration of the 33 connected multigraphs counted in row 5.
formula: T(n,k=3) = A253186(n) = A034253(n,k=2) for n >= 1. - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Oct 02 2019
example: Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k >= 1) begins as follows:
program: InvEulerMT(u)={my(n=#u, p=log(1+x*Ser(u)), vars=variables(p)); Vec(sum(i=1, n, moebius(i)*substvec(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), vars, apply(v->v^i,vars))/i) )}
permcount(v) = {my(m=1, s=0, k=0, t); for(i=1, #v, t=v[i]; k=if(i>1&&t==v[i-1], k+1, 1); m*=t*k; s+=t); s!/m}
{ my(A=R(10)); for(n=1, #A, for(k=1, n, print1(A[n,k], ", "));print) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, May 14 2018
xref: Row sums give A076864. Diagonal is A000055.
results.author: _Alberto Tacchella_, Jul 04 2011
